summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from March to July 2019 between personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, requesting and approving travel for victim interviews related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). The travel is for meetings and interviews with victims in Florida (Palm Beach, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale) and Los Angeles.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: He is the recipient and approver of multiple travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation. He grants approval via email.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: She is consistently copied on the travel approval request emails, indicating her involvement or oversight in the case logistics.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: She is a member of the investigation team traveling to conduct victim interviews in Florida and Los Angeles. She authors one of the travel request emails.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: He is the primary author of most travel request emails, detailing the purpose (victim interviews), destinations, and team composition for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: She is mentioned as a potential team member traveling with Alison or Alex to conduct victim interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618' for enticement of minors for sexual activity.

connections.description: Alex submits travel approval requests to his supervisor, Edward Tyrrell, who approves them.
They are co-workers on the Epstein investigation team, traveling together for victim interviews.
They are mentioned as potential travel companions and team members for conducting victim interviews.
Alex copies Michele Duncan on all travel request emails, indicating a reporting or coordination relationship.
Both are personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS), with Tyrrell copying Duncan on approval communications.
Alex is an AUSA investigating Epstein for federal crimes related to the enticement of minors.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida Interviews
events.description: Alex and an unnamed colleague request permission to travel to West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for two days of meetings and interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel Approval for Florida Interviews
events.description: Edward Tyrrell approves a travel request from Alison and Alex to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in the Epstein case.

events.title: Travel Request for Florida Victim Interviews
events.description: Alex requests permission to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims. Team composition is uncertain (Alex/Alison or Alison/Maurene).

events.title: Travel Approval for Los Angeles Victim Interview
events.description: Edward Tyrrell approves a travel request for the investigation team to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview. The team may include Alex, Alison, and/or Maurene.

events.title: Travel Request for Palm Beach Victim Interviews
events.description: Alison requests permission for the team to travel to Palm Beach, Florida, for victim interviews, planning to be there from Thursday through Sunday and reserving a hotel conference room.

locations: Southern District of New York (office location)
keyFacts: The document reveals active federal investigation (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618) into Jeffrey Epstein for enticement of minors for sexual activity in 2019, months before his arrest and death.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was conducting extensive victim interviews in multiple locations (Florida and California) from at least March to July 2019.
The investigation team included AUSA Alex and colleagues Alison and Maurene, with travel approvals supervised by Edward Tyrrell and coordinated with Michele Duncan.
The emails show a pattern of using hotel conference rooms in destination cities to conduct victim interviews.
The case reference (2018R01618) indicates the investigation was opened in 2018.
